084/**
085 *  Library of utility methods that are useful when dealing with Strings. <br>
086 *  <br>Parts of the code were adopted from the class
087 *  <code>org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils</code> and modified to match the
088 *  requirements of this project. In particular, these are the methods
089 *  <ul>
090 *  <li>{@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int) abbreviate()}</li>
091 *  <li>{@link #capitalize(CharSequence) capitalize()}</li>
092 *  <li>{@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence) escapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
093 *  <li>{@link #isEmpty(CharSequence) isEmpty()}</li>
094 *  <li>{@link #isNotEmpty(CharSequence) isNotEmpty()}</li>
095 *  <li>{@link #repeat(CharSequence, int) repeat()}</li>
096 *  <li>{@link #uncapitalize(CharSequence) uncapitalize()}</li>
097 *  <li>{@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence) unescapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
098 *  </ul>
099 *
100 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
101 *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1033 2022-10-02 13:14:39Z tquadrat $
102 *  @since 0.0.3
103 *
104 *  @UMLGraph.link
105 */
106@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
107@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1033 2022-10-02 13:14:39Z tquadrat $" )
108@UtilityClass
109public final class StringUtils
110{
111        /*---------------*\
112    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
113        \*---------------*/
114    /**
115     *  The clipping mode that is used for the method
116     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
117     *
118     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
119     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1033 2022-10-02 13:14:39Z tquadrat $
120     *  @since 0.0.3
121     *
122     *  @UMLGraph.link
123     */
124    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
125    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1033 2022-10-02 13:14:39Z tquadrat $" )
126    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
127    public static enum Clipping
128    {
129            /*------------------*\
130        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
131            \*------------------*/
132        /**
133         *  If an input String is already longer than the target length, it
134         *  will be returned unchanged.
135         */
136        CLIPPING_NONE
137        {
138            /**
139             *  {@inheritDoc}
140             */
141            @Override
142            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return s.toString(); }
143        },
144
145        /**
146         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
147         *  just shortened to that length.
148         */
149        CLIPPING_CUT
150        {
151            /**
152             *  {@inheritDoc}
153             */
154            @Override
155            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length )
156            {
157                final var retValue = (s.length() > length ? s.subSequence( 0, length ) : s).toString();
158
159                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
160                return retValue;
161            }   //  clip()
162        },
163
164        /**
165         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
166         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
167         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}
168         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 4.
169         */
170        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE
171        {
172            /**
173             *  {@inheritDoc}
174             */
175            @Override
176            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviate( s, length ); }
177        },
178
179        /**
180         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
181         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
182         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviateMiddle(CharSequence, int)}
183         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 5.
184         */
185        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
186        {
187            /**
188             *  {@inheritDoc}
189             */
190            @Override
191            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviateMiddle( s, length ); }
192        };
193
194            /*---------*\
195        ====** Methods **======================================================
196            \*---------*/
197        /**
198         *  Clips the given input String.
199         *
200         *  @param  s   The input String.
201         *  @param  length  The target length.
202         *  @return The result String.
203         */
204        protected abstract String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length );
205    }
206    //  enum Clipping
207
208    /**
209     *  The padding mode that is used for the methods
210     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,boolean)}
211     *  and
212     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
213     *
214     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
215     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1033 2022-10-02 13:14:39Z tquadrat $
216     *  @since 0.0.5
217     *
218     *  @UMLGraph.link
219     */
220    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
221    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1033 2022-10-02 13:14:39Z tquadrat $" )
222    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
223    public static enum Padding
224    {
225            /*------------------*\
226        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
227            \*------------------*/
228        /**
229         *  The pad characters are distributed evenly at begin and end of the
230         *  string.
231         */
232        PADDING_CENTER
233        {
234            /**
235             *  {@inheritDoc}
236             */
237            @Override
238            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
239            {
240                final var rightSize = padSize / 2;
241                final var leftSize = padSize - rightSize;
242                final var retValue = padding( leftSize, c ) + s.toString() + padding( rightSize, c );
243
244                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
245                return retValue;
246            }   //  pad()
247        },
248
249        /**
250         *  The pad characters are added at the beginning of the string
251         *  (prefixing it).
252         */
253        PADDING_LEFT
254        {
255            /**
256             *  {@inheritDoc}
257             */
258            @Override
259            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
260            {
261                return padding( padSize, c ) + s.toString();
262            }   //  pad()
263        },
264
265        /**
266         *  The pad characters are added the end of the string (as a suffix).
267         */
268        PADDING_RIGHT
269        {
270            /**
271             *  {@inheritDoc}
272             */
273            @Override
274            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
275            {
276                return s.toString() + padding( padSize, c );
277            }   //  pad()
278        };
279
280            /*---------*\
281        ====** Methods **======================================================
282            \*---------*/
283        /**
284         *  Pads the given input String.
285         *
286         *  @param  s   The input String.
287         *  @param  padSize The pad size.
288         *  @param  c   The pad character.
289         *  @return The result String.
290         */
291        protected abstract String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c );
292
293        /**
294         *  Returns padding using the specified pad character repeated to the
295         *  given length.<br>
296         *  <br><code>
297         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;0,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
298         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;3,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"eee"<br>
299         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;-2,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;IndexOutOfBoundsException<br>
300         *  </code>
301         *
302         *  @param  repeat  Number of times to repeat {@code padChar}; must be
303         *      0 or greater.
304         *  @param  padChar Character to repeat.
305         *  @return String with repeated {@code padChar} character, or the
306         *      empty String if {@code repeat} is 0.
307         *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {@code repeat} is less than 0.
308         *
309         *  @see StringUtils#repeat(int,int)
310         */
311        private static String padding( final int repeat, final char padChar ) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
312        {
313            if( repeat < 0 ) throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException( format( MSG_PadNegative, repeat ) );
314
315            final var retValue = Character.toString( padChar ).repeat( repeat ).intern();
316
317            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
318            return retValue;
319        }   //  padding()
320    }
321    //  enum Padding
322
323        /*-----------*\
324    ====** Constants **========================================================
325        \*-----------*/
326    /**
327     *  <p>{@summary The regular expression for an HTML or XML comment:
328     *  {@value}.}</p>
329     *  <p>This pattern is used by the
330     *  {@link #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)}
331     *  method.</p>
332     *
333     *  @since 0.0.5
334     */
335    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
336    public static final String COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN = "<!--.+?-->";
337
338    /**
339     *  The initial buffer size that is used by
340     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)}
341     *  and
342     *  {@link #format(Locale, String, Object...)}
343     *  (per thread): {@value}.
344     *
345     *  @since 0.0.5
346     */
347    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
348    public static final int FORMAT_INITIAL_BUFFERSIZE = 2048;
349
350    /**
351     *  The message text indicating that the given value for the abbreviation
352     *  target length is too short.
353     */
354    private static final String MSG_AbbrTooShort = "The minimum abbreviation width is %d";
355
356    /**
357     *  The message indicating that the give size for padding is negative.
358     */
359    private static final String MSG_PadNegative = "Cannot pad a negative amount: %d";
360
361    /**
362     *  The maximum size to which the padding constant(s) can expand: {@value}.
363     *
364     *  @see #repeat(CharSequence,int) repeat() for String
365     *  @see #repeat(char,int) repeat() for char
366     */
367    @SuppressWarnings( "unused" )
368    private static final int PAD_LIMIT = 8192;
369
370    /**
371     *  The regular expression for an HTML or XML tag: {@value}.<br>
372     *  <br>This pattern is used by the
373     *  {@link #stripTags(CharSequence)}
374     *  method.<br>
375     *  <br>As HTML/XML comments may contain a &quot;greater than&quot; sign
376     *  ('&gt;' or '&amp;gt;'), it is necessary to treat comments
377     *  separately.<br>
378     *  <br>Just as a reminder: several sources recommend using the following
379     *  idiom for embedded JavaScript:<pre><code>  &lt;script&gt;
380     *  &lt;!--
381     *  <i>JavaScript code </i>
382     *  --&gt;
383     *  &lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>
384     *
385     *  @since 0.0.5
386     */
387    @SuppressWarnings( "RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup" )
388    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
389    public static final String TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN = "(?:<!--.+?-->)|(?:<[^>]+?>)";
390
391    /**
392     *  The regular expression to identify a variable in a char sequence:
393     *  {@value}.
394     *
395     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
396     *  @see #isValidVariableName(CharSequence)
397     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence,Map...)
398     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Function)
399     *
400     *  @since 0.0.5
401     *  @deprecated Use
402     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_PATTERN}
403     *      instead.
404     */
405    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
406    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
407    public static final String VARIABLE_PATTERN = Template.VARIABLE_PATTERN;
408
409    /**
410     *  The template for variables: {@value}. The argument is the name of the
411     *  variable itself; after an optional prefix character, it may not contain
412     *  other characters than the letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower
413     *  case), the digits from '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore
414     *  ('_') and dot ('.').<br>
415     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
416     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
417     *  ('&amp;').<br>
418     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
419     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
420     *  special variable.
421     *
422     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
423     *
424     *  @since 0.0.5
425     *  @deprecated Use
426     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_TEMPLATE}
427     *      instead.
428     */
429    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
430    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
431    public static final String VARIABLE_TEMPLATE = Template.VARIABLE_TEMPLATE;
432

434    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
435        \*------------------------*/
436    /**
437     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML comment.
438     *
439     *  @see #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)
440     *  @see #COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN
441     */
442    private static final Pattern m_CommentRemovalPattern;
443
444    /**
445     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML tag.
446     *
447     *  @see #stripTags(CharSequence)
448     *  @see #TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN
449     */
450    private static final Pattern m_TagRemovalPattern;
451
452    static
453    {
454        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
455        try
456        {
457            m_CommentRemovalPattern = compile( COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
458            m_TagRemovalPattern = compile( TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
459        }
460        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
461        {
462            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
463        }
464    }

472    private StringUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( StringUtils.class ); }

474        /*---------*\
475    ====** Methods **==========================================================
476        \*---------*/
477    /**
478     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
479     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
480     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is the time for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
481     *  <br>Specifically:
482     *  <ul>
483     *  <li>If {@code text} is less than {@code maxWidth} characters long,
484     *  return it unchanged.</li>
485     *  <li>Else abbreviate it to <code>(substring( text, 0, max - 1 ) +
486     *  &quot;&hellip;&quot; )</code>.</li>
487     *  <li>If {@code maxWidth} is less than 4, throw an
488     *  {@link ValidationException}.</li>
489     *  <li>In no case it will return a String of length greater than
490     *  {@code maxWidth}.</li>
491     *  </ul>
492     *  Some samples:<br>
493     *  <pre><code>
494     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, * )      = null
495     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 4 )        = ""
496     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abc", 4 ) = "abc"
497     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcd", 4 ) = "abcd;"
498     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 4 ) = "abc&hellip;"
499     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 7 ) = "abcdefg"
500     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 8 ) = "abcdefg"
501     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 3 ) = IllegalArgumentException
502     *  </code></pre>
503     *
504     *  @param  text    The String to abbreviate, can be {@code null}.
505     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
506     *      least 4.
507     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
508     *      already {@code null}.
509     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
510     *      than 4.
511     *
512     *  @since 0.0.5
513     */
514    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
515    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
516    {
517        return abbreviate( text, 0, maxWidth );
518    }   //  abbreviate()
519
520    /**
521     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
522     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
523     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>&hellip;is the time
524     *  for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
525     *  <br>Works like
526     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)},
527     *  but allows to specify a &quot;left edge&quot; offset. Note that this
528     *  left edge is not necessarily going to be the leftmost character in the
529     *  result, or the first character following the ellipses, but it will
530     *  appear somewhere in the result. An offset less than 0 will be treated
531     *  as 0, a value greater than {@code maxWidth} will be ignored.<br>
532     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
533     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
534     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
535     *  <pre>
536     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, *, * )                = null
537     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 0, 4 )                  = ""
538     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", -1, 10 ) = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
539     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 0, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
540     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 1, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
541     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 4, 10 )  = "&hellip;efghijkl&hellip;"
542     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 5, 10 )  = "&hellip;fghijklm&hellip;"
543     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 6, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
544     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 8, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
545     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 10, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
546     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 12, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
547     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 0, 3 )        = IllegalArgumentException
548     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 5, 6 )        = IllegalArgumentException
549     *  </pre>
550     *
551     *  @param  text    The String to process, can be {@code null}.
552     *  @param  offset  The left edge of the source String; this value will not
553     *      be checked.
554     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
555     *      least 4.
556     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
557     *      already {@code null}.
558     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
559     *      than 4.
560     *
561     *  @since 0.0.5
562     */
563    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
564    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int offset, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
565    {
566        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
567
568        String retValue = null;
569        if( nonNull( text ) )
570        {
571            if( maxWidth < 4 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 4 ) );
572
573            final var len = text.length();
574            if( len > maxWidth )
575            {
576                var effectiveOffset = min( offset, len);
577                if( (len - effectiveOffset) < (maxWidth - 1))
578                {
579                    effectiveOffset = len - (maxWidth - 1);
580                }
581                if( effectiveOffset <= 1 )
582                {
583                    retValue = text.subSequence( 0, maxWidth - 1 ) + ellipsis;
584                }
585                else
586                {
587                    if( ((effectiveOffset + maxWidth) - 1) < len )
588                    {
589                        retValue = ellipsis + abbreviate( text.subSequence( effectiveOffset, len ), maxWidth - 1 );
590                    }
591                    else
592                    {
593                        retValue = ellipsis + text.subSequence( len - (maxWidth - 1), len );
594                    }
595                }
596            }
597            else
598            {
599                retValue = text.toString();
600            }
601        }
602
603        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
604        return retValue;
605    }   //  abbreviate()
606
607    /**
608     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
609     *  0x2026) in the middle of the returned text. This will turn &quot;<i>Now
610     *  is the time for all good men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is &hellip;
611     *  good men</i>&quot;<br>
612     *  <br>Works like
613     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}.<br>
614     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
615     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
616     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
617     *  <pre>
618     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle(null, *)      = null
619     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("", 5)        = ""
620     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 5) = "ab&hellip;gh"
621     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 7) = "ab&hellip;gh"
622     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 8) = "abcdefgh"
623     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 4) = IllegalArgumentException
624     *  </pre>
625     *
626     *  @param  str The String to check, may be {@code null}.
627     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
628     *      least 5.
629     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
630     *      already {@code null}.
631     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
632     *      than 5.
633     *
634     *  @since 0.0.5
635     */
636    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
637    public static final String abbreviateMiddle( final CharSequence str, final int maxWidth )
638    {
639        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
640
641        String retValue = null;
642        if( nonNull( str ) )
643        {
644            if( maxWidth < 5 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 5 ) );
645
646            final var len = str.length();
647            if( len > maxWidth )
648            {
649                final var suffixLength = (maxWidth - 1) / 2;
650                final var prefixLength = maxWidth - 1 - suffixLength;
651                final var suffixStart = len - suffixLength;
652                retValue = str.subSequence( 0, prefixLength ) + ellipsis + str.subSequence( suffixStart, suffixStart + suffixLength );
653            }
654            else
655            {
656                retValue = str.toString();
657            }
658        }
659
660        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
661        return retValue;
662    }   //  abbreviateMiddle()
663
664    /**
665     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a long string into chunks of the given length.}</p>
666     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
667     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array or a
668     *  collection.</p>
669     *  <p>To array:</p>
670     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
671     *  <p>To collection (here: a
672     *  {@link List}):</p>
673     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
674     *
675     *  @param  s   The string.
676     *  @param  chunk   The chunk size.
677     *  @return The chunks from the string; the last chunk could be shorter
678     *      than the others.
679     *
680     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
681     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
682     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
683     *
684     *  @since 0.0.5
685     */
686    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
687    public static final Stream<String> breakString( final CharSequence s, final int chunk )
688    {
689        if( chunk < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Chunk size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", chunk ) );
690
691        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
692        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
693        var pos = 0;
694        while( (pos + chunk) < len )
695        {
696            builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, pos + chunk ).toString() );
697            pos += chunk;
698        }
699        if( pos < len ) builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, len ).toString() );
700
701        final var retValue = builder.build();
702
703        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
704        return retValue;
705    }   //  breakString()
706
707    /**
708     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a text into lines of the given length, but
709     *  different from
710     *  {@link #breakString(CharSequence, int)},
711     *  it will honour whitespace.}</p>
712     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
713     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array, a String, or
714     *  a collection.</p>
715     *  <p>To array:</p>
716     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
717     *  <p>To String:</p>
718     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.joining() )</code></pre>
719     *  <p>To collection (here: a
720     *  {@link List}):</p>
721     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
722     *
723     *  @param  text    The text.
724     *  @param  lineLength  The length of a line.
725     *  @return The lines; if a word is longer than the given line length, a
726     *      line containing only that word can be longer that the given line
727     *      length.
728     *
729     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
730     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
731     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
732     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence)
733     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence)
734     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
735     *
736     *  @since 0.0.5
737     */
738    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
739    public static final Stream<String> breakText( final CharSequence text, final int lineLength )
740    {
741        if( lineLength < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Line length size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", lineLength ) );
742
743        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
744
745        for( final var line : splitString( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ), '\n' ) )
746        {
747            if( isEmptyOrBlank( line ) )
748            {
749                builder.add( EMPTY_STRING );
750            }
751            else
752            {
753                final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
754                final var chunks = line.split( "\\s" );
755                SplitLoop: for( final var c : chunks )
756                {
757                    if( c.isEmpty() ) continue SplitLoop;
758                    if( (buffer.length() + 1 + c.length()) < lineLength )
759                    {
760                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer) ) buffer.append( ' ' );
761                    }
762                    else
763                    {
764                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) )
765                        {
766                            builder.add( buffer.toString() );
767                            buffer.setLength( 0 );
768                        }
769                    }
770                    buffer.append( c );
771                }   //  SplitLoop:
772                if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) ) builder.add( buffer.toString() );
773            }
774        }
775
776        final var retValue = builder.build();
777
778        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
779        return retValue;
780    }   //  breakText()
781
782    /**
783     *  <p>{@summary <i>Capitalises</i> a String, meaning changing the first
784     *  letter to upper case as per
785     *  {@link Character#toUpperCase(char)}.} No other letters are changed.</p>
786     *  <p>A {@code null} input String returns {@code null}.</p>
787     *  <p>Samples:</p>
788     *  <pre><code>  StringUtils.capitalize( null )  == null;
789     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;&quot; )    == &quot;&quot;;
790     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cat&quot; ) == &quot;Cat&quot;;
791     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cAt&quot; ) == &quot;CAt&quot;;</code></pre>
792     *  <p>Use this function to create a getter or setter name from the name of
793     *  the attribute.</p>
794     *  <p>This method does not recognise the
795     *  {@linkplain java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}.
796     *  This means that &quot;istanbul&quot; will become &quot;Istanbul&quot;
797     *  even for the locale {@code tr_TR} (although &quot;&#x130;stanbul&quot;
798     *  would be correct).</p>
799     *
800     *  @param c    The String to capitalise, can be {@code null}.
801     *  @return The capitalised String, or {@code null} if the argument
802     *      was already {@code null}.
803     *
804     *  @see #decapitalize(CharSequence)
805     *
806     *  @since 0.0.5
807     */
808    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
809    public static final String capitalize( final CharSequence c )
810    {
811        String retValue = null;
812        if( nonNull( c ) )
813        {
814            @SuppressWarnings( "LocalVariableNamingConvention" )
815            final var s = c.toString();
816            if( s.isEmpty() )
817            {
818                retValue = s;
819            }
820            else
821            {
822                retValue = (toUpperCase( s.charAt( 0 ) ) + s.substring( 1 )).intern();
823            }
824        }
825
826        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
827        return retValue;
828    }   //  capitalize()
829
830    /**
831     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
832     *  longer than the given maximum length.
833     *
834     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
835     *      will be thrown.
836     *  @param  text    The text to check.
837     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
838     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
839     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
840     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
841     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
842     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
843     *      {@code maxLength}.
844     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException {@code text} is the empty String.
845     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
846     *      {@code null}.
847     *
848     *  @deprecated Replaced by
849     *      {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)}
850     */
851    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
852    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
853    public static final String checkText( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
854    {
855        return checkTextLen( name, text, maxLength );
856    }   //  checkText()

858    /**
859     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
860     *  longer than the given maximum length. Use this to check whether a
861     *  String that is provided as an argument to a method is longer than
862     *  expected.
863     *
864     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
865     *      will be thrown. Usually this is the name of the argument to
866     *      validate.
867     *  @param  text    The text to check.
868     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
869     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
870     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
871     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
872     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
873     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
874     *      {@code maxLength}.
875     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
876     *      the empty String.
877     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
878     *      {@code null}.
879     *
880     *  @since 0.0.5
881     */
882    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
883    public static final String checkTextLen( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
884    {
885        if( requireNotEmptyArgument( text, requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ) ).length() > maxLength )
886        {
887            throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
888        }
889
890        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
891        return text.toString();
892    }   //  checkTextLen()
893
894    /**
895     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
896     *  different from
897     *  {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)},
898     *  it may be {@code null} or empty.
899     *
900     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
901     *      will be thrown.
902     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
903     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
904     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String, {@code null}
905     *      if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the argument fails any of the
906     *      tests, an
907     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
908     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
909     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
910     *      {@code maxLength}.
911     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is empty.
912     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
913     *
914     *  @since 0.0.5
915     */
916    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
917    public static final String checkTextLenNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException
918    {
919        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
920
921        String retValue = null;
922        if( nonNull( text ) )
923        {
924            if( text.length() > maxLength )
925            {
926                throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
927            }
928            retValue = text.toString();
929        }
930
931        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
932        return retValue;
933    }   //  checkTextLenNull()
934
935    /**
936     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
937     *  it may be {@code null}.
938     *
939     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
940     *      will be thrown.
941     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
942     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
943     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String,
944     *      {@code null} if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the
945     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
946     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
947     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
948     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
949     *      {@code maxLength}.
950     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
951     *
952     *  @deprecated Replaced by
953     *      {@link #checkTextLenNull(String, CharSequence, int)}.
954     */
955    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
956    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
957    public static final String checkTextNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength )
958    {
959        return checkTextLenNull( name, text, maxLength );
960    }   //  checkTextNull()

962    /**
963     *  Changes the first letter of the given String tolower case as per
964     *  {@link Character#toLowerCase(char)}.
965     *  No other letters are changed. A {@code null} input String returns
966     *  {@code null}.<br>
967     *  <br>Samples:<pre><code>  StringUtils.decapitalize( null ) = null;
968     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;&quot;)     = &quot;&quot;;
969     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;Cat&quot;)  = &quot;cat&quot;;
970     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;CAT&quot;)  = &quot;cAT&quot;;</code></pre>
971     *  <br>Basically, this is the complementary method to
972     *  {@link #capitalize(CharSequence)}.
973     *  Use this method to normalise the name of bean attributes.
974     *
975     *  @param  s   The String to <i>decapitalise</i>, may be {@code null}.
976     *  @return The <i>decapitalised</i> String, {@code null} if the argument
977     *      was {@code null}.
978     *  @see #capitalize(CharSequence)
979     *
980     *  @since 0.0.5
981     */
982    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
983    public static final String decapitalize( final CharSequence s )
984    {
985        String retValue = null;
986
987        if( nonNull( s ) )
988        {
989            retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
990            if( isNotEmpty( s ) )
991            {
992                final var str = s.toString();
993                retValue = (toLowerCase( str.charAt( 0 ) ) + str.substring( 1 )).intern();
994            }
995        }
996
997        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
998        return retValue;
999    }   //  decapitalize()
1000
1001    /**
1002     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the non-ASCII and special characters in a
1003     *  {@code String} so that the result can be used in the context of HTML.}
1004     *  Wherever possible, the method will return the respective HTML&nbsp;5
1005     *  entity; only when there is no matching entity, it will use the Unicode
1006     *  escape.</p>
1007     *  <p>So if you call the method with the argument
1008     *  &quot;<i>S&uuml;&szlig;e</i>&quot;, it will return
1009     *  &quot;<code>S&amp;uuml;&amp;szlig;e</code>&quot;.</p>
1010     *  <p>If the input will be, for example, a Chinese text like this:
1011     *  &quot;<i>çä½</i>&quot; (means "Ball"), you may get back something like
1012     *  this: &quot;<code>&amp;#x7403;&amp;#x4F53;</code>&quot;, as there are
1013     *  no entities defined for (any) Chinese letters.</p>
1014     *  <p>The method supports all known HTML&nbsp;5.0 entities, including
1015     *  funky accents. But it will not escape several commonly used characters
1016     *  like the full stop ('.'), the comma (','), the colon (':'), or the
1017     *  semicolon (';'), although they will be handled properly by
1018     *  {@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)}.</p>
1019     *  <p>Note that the commonly used apostrophe escape character
1020     *  (&amp;apos;) that was not a legal entity for HTML before HTML&nbsp;5 is
1021     *  now supported.</p>
1022     *
1023     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1024     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1025     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1026     *
1027     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1028     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1029     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1030     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1031     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1032     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1033     *
1034     *  @since 0.0.5
1035     */
1036    /*
1037     *  For some unknown reasons, JavaDoc will not accept the entities &#x7403;
1038     *  and &#x4F53; (for 'ç' and 'ä½'), therefore it was required to add the
1039     *  Chinese character directly into the comment above.
1040     */
1041    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1042    public static final String escapeHTML( final CharSequence str )
1043    {
1044        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? HTML50.escape( str ) : null;
1045
1046        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1047        return retValue;
1048    }   //  escapeHTML()
1049
1050    /**
1051     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using HTML entities and
1052     *  writes them to an
1053     *  {@link Appendable}.
1054     *  For details, refer to
1055     *  {@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence)}.
1056     *
1057     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1058     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1059     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1060     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1061     *      from calls to the
1062     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1063     *      method.
1064     *
1065     *  @see #escapeHTML(CharSequence)
1066     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1067     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1068     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1069     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1070     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1071     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1072     *
1073     *  @since 0.0.5
1074     */
1075    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1076    public static final void escapeHTML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1077    {
1078        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1079
1080        if( nonNull( str ) ) HTML50.escape( appendable, str );
1081    }   //  escapeHTML()
1082
1083    /**
1084     *  Formats the given {@code String} for the output into JSONText. This
1085     *  means that the input sequence will be surrounded by double quotes, and
1086     *  backslash sequences are put into all the right places.<br>
1087     *  <br>&lt; and &gt; will be inserted as their Unicode values, allowing
1088     *  JSON text to be delivered in HTML.<br>
1089     *  <br>In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an
1090     *  unescaped quote or backslash, so these are translated to Unicode
1091     *  escapes also.
1092     *
1093     *  @param  str The string to escape to the JSON format; it may be empty,
1094     *      but not {@code null}.
1095     *  @return A string correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
1096     *
1097     *  @since 0.0.5
1098     */
1099    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyComplexMethod" )
1100    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1101    public static final String escapeJSON( final CharSequence str )
1102    {
1103        var retValue = "\"\""; // The JSON empty string.
1104        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ).length();
1105        if( len > 0 )
1106        {
1107            final var buffer = new StringBuilder( len * 2 ).append( '"' );
1108            @SuppressWarnings( "LocalVariableNamingConvention" )
1109            char c;
1110            for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
1111            {
1112                c = str.charAt( i );
1113                switch( c )
1114                {
1115                    case '\\', '"', '<', '>', '&' -> buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1116
1117                    case '\b' -> buffer.append( "\\b" );
1118
1119                    case '\t' -> buffer.append( "\\t" );
1120
1121                    case '\n'-> buffer.append( "\\n" );
1122
1123                    case '\f' -> buffer.append( "\\f" );
1124
1125                    case '\r' -> buffer.append( "\\r" );
1126
1127                    default ->
1128                    {
1129                        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression,CharacterComparison,UnnecessaryUnicodeEscape
1130                        if( (c < ' ')
1131                            || ((c >= '\u0080') && (c < '\u00a0'))
1132                            || ((c >= '\u2000') && (c < '\u2100')) )
1133                        {
1134                            buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1135                        }
1136                        else
1137                        {
1138                            buffer.append( c );
1139                        }
1140                    }
1141                }
1142            }
1143            buffer.append( '"' );
1144            retValue = buffer.toString();
1145        }
1146
1147        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1148        return retValue;
1149    }   //  escapeJSON()
1150
1151    /**
1152     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes and writes them to a
1153     *  {@link Appendable}.
1154     *
1155     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1156     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1157     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1158     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1159     *      from calls to the
1160     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1161     *      method.
1162     *
1163     *  @since 0.0.5
1164     */
1165    @SuppressWarnings( "SwitchStatementWithTooManyBranches" )
1166    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1167    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final char c ) throws IOException
1168    {
1169        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1170
1171        TestSwitch: switch( c )
1172        {
1173            case '\\' -> appendable.append( "\\" );
1174            case '[', ']', '{', '}', '(', ')', '^', '$', '&', '*', '.', '+', '|', '?' -> appendable.append( "\\" ).append( c );
1175            case '\t' -> appendable.append( "\\t" );
1176            case '\n' -> appendable.append( "\\n" );
1177            case '\r' -> appendable.append( "\\r" );
1178            case '\f' -> appendable.append( "\\f" );
1179            case '\u0007' -> appendable.append( "\\a" );
1180            case '\u001B' -> appendable.append( "\\e" ); // ESC
1181            default -> appendable.append( c );
1182        }   //  TestSwitch:
1183    }   //  escapeRegex()
1184
1185    /**
1186     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes.
1187     *
1188     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1189     *  @return A {@code String} with the escaped character.
1190     *
1191     *  @since 0.0.5
1192     */
1193    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1194    public static final String escapeRegex( final char c )
1195    {
1196        final var retValue = new StringBuilder();
1197        try
1198        {
1199            escapeRegex( retValue, c );
1200        }
1201        catch( final IOException e )
1202        {
1203            /*
1204             * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1205             * not define an IOException.
1206             */
1207            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1208        }
1209
1210        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1211        return retValue.toString();
1212    }   //  escapeRegex()
1213
1214    /**
1215     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes.
1216     *
1217     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1218     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the argument
1219     *      was already {@code null}.
1220     *
1221     *  @since 0.0.5
1222     */
1223    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1224    public static final String escapeRegex( final CharSequence str )
1225    {
1226        String retValue = null;
1227        if( nonNull( str ) )
1228        {
1229            final var len = str.length();
1230            if( len > 0 )
1231            {
1232                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
1233                try
1234                {
1235                    escapeRegex( buffer, str );
1236                }
1237                catch( final IOException e )
1238                {
1239                    /*
1240                     * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1241                     * not define an IOException.
1242                     */
1243                    throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1244                }
1245                retValue = buffer.toString();
1246            }
1247            else
1248            {
1249                retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
1250            }
1251        }
1252
1253        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1254        return retValue;
1255    }   //  escapeRegex()
1256
1257    /**
1258     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes and
1259     *  writes them to a
1260     *  {@link Appendable}.
1261     *
1262     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1263     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape. If {@code null} or the empty
1264     *      String, nothing will be put to the appendable.
1265     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1266     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1267     *      from calls to the
1268     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1269     *      method.
1270     *
1271     *  @since 0.0.5
1272     */
1273    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1274    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1275    {
1276        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1277
1278        if( isNotEmpty( str ) )
1279        {
1280            ScanLoop: for( var i = 0; i < str.length(); ++i )
1281            {
1282                escapeRegex( appendable, str.charAt( i ) );
1283            }   //  ScanLoop:
1284        }
1285    }   //  escapeRegex()
1286
1287    /**
1288     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given character. This will
1289     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1290     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1291     *  <br>This method should be used only for characters that are not
1292     *  surrogates; for general use, the implementation that takes a code point
1293     *  is preferred.
1294     *
1295     *  @param  c   The character.
1296     *  @return The escape sequence.
1297     *
1298     *  @see #escapeUnicode(int)
1299     *
1300     *  @since 0.0.5
1301     *  @deprecated Use
1302     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(char)}
1303     *      instead.
1304     */
1305    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
1306    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1307    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1308    public static final String escapeUnicode( final char c ) { return escapeCharacter( c ); }
1309
1310    /**
1311     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given code point. This will
1312     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1313     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1314     *  <br>This method takes only a single code point; to translate a whole
1315     *  String, this code sequence can be used:<pre><code>  &hellip;
1316     *  String result = input.codePoints()
1317     *      .mapToObj( codePoint -&gt; escapeUnicode( codePoint ) )
1318     *      .collect( Collectors.joining() );
1319     *  &hellip;</code></pre>
1320     *  This will escape <i>all</i> characters in the String. If only a subset
1321     *  needs to be escaped, the mapping function in
1322     *  {@link java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction) mapToObj()}
1323     *  can be adjusted accordingly. Something like that is implemented with
1324     *  the method
1325     *  {@link #toUnicode(CharSequence)}.
1326     *
1327     *  @param  codePoint   The character.
1328     *  @return The escape sequence.
1329     *
1330     *  @see String#codePoints()
1331     *  @see java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction)
1332     *  @see java.util.stream.Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
1333     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
1334     *
1335     *  @since 0.0.5
1336     *  @deprecated Use
1337     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(int)}
1338     *      instead.
1339     */
1340    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
1341    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1342    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1343    public static final String escapeUnicode( final int codePoint ) { return escapeCharacter( codePoint ); }
1344
1345    /**
1346     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1347     *  entities.}</p>
1348     *  <p>For example:</p>
1349     *  <p>{@code "bread" & "butter"}</p>
1350     *  <p>becomes:</p>
1351     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1352     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.</p>
1353     *
1354     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be null.
1355     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1356     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1357     *
1358     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
1359     */
1360    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1361    public static final String escapeXML( final CharSequence str )
1362    {
1363        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? XML.escape( str ) : null;
1364
1365        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1366        return retValue;
1367    }   //  escapeXML()

1369    /**
1370     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1371     *  entities and writes them to an
1372     *  {@link Appendable}.}</p>
1373     *  <p>For example:</p>
1374     *  <p>{@code "bread" & "butter"}</p>
1375     *  <p>becomes:</p>
1376     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1377     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.</p>
1378     *
1379     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1380     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.

1383     *      from calls to the
1384     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1385     *      method.
1386     *

1400    /**
1401     *  Collects all the variables of the form
1402     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String.<br>
1403     *  <br>If there are not any variables in the given String, an empty
1404     *  {@link Collection}
1405     *  will be returned.<br>
1406     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
1407     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
1408     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
1409     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
1410     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
1411     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
1412     *  ('&amp;').<br>
1413     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
1414     *  special variable.
1415     *
1416     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
1417     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
1418     *
1419     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
1420     *
1421     *  @since 0.0.5
1422     *  @deprecated Use
1423     *      {@link Template#findVariables(CharSequence)}
1424     *      instead.
1425     */
1426    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
1427    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1428    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1429    public static final Collection<String> findVariables( final CharSequence text )
1430    {
1431        return Template.findVariables( text );
1432    }   //  findVariables()
1433
1434    /**
1435     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified format String and
1436     *  arguments.<br>
1437     *  <br>The implementation uses internally the
1438     *  {@link Locale}
1439     *  that is returned by
1440     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() Locale.getDefault()}.<br>
1441     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1442     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1443     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1444     *  {@link Formatter}
1445     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1446     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1447     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1448     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1449     *  <br>This implementation is about as twice as fast as
1450     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1451     *
1452     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1453     *      {@link Formatter}
1454     *      class.
1455     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1456     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1457     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1458     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1459     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1460     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1461     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1462     *      depends on the conversion.
1463     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1464     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1465     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1466     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1467     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1468     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1469     *  @return A formatted String.
1470     *
1471     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1472     *
1473     *  @since 0.0.5
1474     */
1475    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1476    public static final String format( final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1477    {
1478        return SharedFormatter.format( format, args );
1479    }   //  format()
1480
1481    /**
1482     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified
1483     *  {@link Locale},
1484     *  format String, and arguments.<br>
1485     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1486     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1487     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1488     *  {@link Formatter}
1489     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1490     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1491     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1492     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1493     *  <br>The performance gain for this implementation is not that impressive
1494     *  when compared with that of
1495     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)},
1496     *  but still in the 10% range.
1497     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1498     *
1499     *  @param  locale  The
1500     *      {@link Locale}
1501     *      that will be applied during formatting. If {@code locale} is
1502     *      {@code null} then no localisation is applied.
1503     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1504     *      {@link Formatter}
1505     *      class.
1506     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1507     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1508     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1509     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1510     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1511     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1512     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1513     *      depends on the conversion.
1514     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1515     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1516     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1517     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1518     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1519     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1520     *  @return A formatted String.
1521     *
1522     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1523     *
1524     *  @since 0.0.5
1525     */
1526    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1527    public static final String format( final Locale locale, final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1528    {
1529        return SharedFormatter.format( locale, format, args );
1530    }   //  format()

1709    @Deprecated( since = "Java 9", forRemoval = true )
1710    public static final String joinString( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> s, final CharSequence separator )
1711    {
1712        final var retValue = join( requireNonNullArgument( separator, "separator" ), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1713
1714        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1715        return retValue;
1716    }   //  joinString()

1718    /**
1719     *  Combines the given
1720     *  {@link Stream}
1721     *  of Strings to a single string, with the given separator.
1722     *
1723     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1724     *  @param  separator   The separator; may be empty, but not {@code null}.
1725     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence stream is empty,
1726     *      the empty String will be returned.
1727     *
1728     *  @deprecated This method is obsolete; the same effect can be achieved
1729     *      easily by calling
1730     *      {@link Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)}
1731     *      on the stream, with the collector
1732     *      {@link java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence) joining()}
1733     *      as its argument.
1734     */
1735    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1736    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )
1737    public static final String joinString( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> s, final CharSequence separator )
1738    {
1739        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).collect( joining( separator ) );
1740
1741        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1742        return retValue;
1743    }   //  joinString()

1745    /**

1749     *  @param  s   The input sequence.

1751     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence array is empty, the
1752     *      empty String will be returned.

1755     *      easily by calling

1758    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )

1761    {

1763
1764        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1765        return retValue;
1766    }   //  joinString()

1774     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence collection is empty, the
1775     *      empty String will be returned.

1781    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )

1785        final var retValue = join( Character.toString( separator), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1786
1787        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1788        return retValue;

1791    /**
1792     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1793     *  collection.<br>
1794     *  <br>For an array, this method can be called like this:<pre><code>  String [] a = {"1", "2", "3"};
1795     *  maxContentLength( Arrays.asList( a ) );</code></pre>
1796     *
1797     *  @param  list    The strings.
1798     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1799     *      in the list are {@code null}.
1800     *
1801     *  @deprecated Use
1802     *      {@link #maxContentLength(CharSequence[])},
1803     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Collection)},
1804     *      or
1805     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Stream)}
1806     *      instead.
1807     */
1808    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
1809    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
1810    public static final int maxContentLength( final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> list )
1811    {
1812        var retValue = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
1813        int len;
1814        for( final var cs : requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ) )
1815        {
1816            len = nonNull( cs ) ? cs.length() : -1;
1817            if( len > retValue )
1818            {
1819                retValue = len;
1820            }
1821        }
1822
1823        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1824        return retValue;
1825    }   //  maxContentLength()
1826
1827    /**
1828     *  Determines the maximum length over all Strings provided in the given
1829     *  {@link Stream}.
1830     *
1831     *  @param  stream  The strings.
1832     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1833     *      in the given {@code stream} are {@code null}, and
1834     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1835     *      if the given {@code stream} is empty.
1836     *
1837     *  @since 0.0.5
1838     */
1839    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1840    public static final int maxContentLength( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> stream )
1841    {
1842        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stream, "stream" )
1843            .mapToInt( s -> nonNull( s ) ? s.length() : -1 )
1844            .max()
1845            .orElse( Integer.MIN_VALUE );
1846
1847        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1848        return retValue;
1849    }   //  maxContentLength()
1850
1851    /**
1852     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1853     *  {@link Collection}.
1854     *
1855     *  @param  list    The strings.
1856     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1857     *      in the given {@code list} are {@code null}, and
1858     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1859     *      if the given {@code list} is empty.
1860     *
1861     *  @since 0.0.5
1862     */
1863    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1864    public static final int maxContentLength( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> list )
1865    {
1866        final var retValue = maxContentLength( requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).stream() );
1867
1868        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1869        return retValue;
1870    }   //  maxContentLength()
1871
1872    /**
1873     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1874     *  array.
1875     *
1876     *  @param  a   The strings.
1877     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1878     *      in the array are {@code null}, and
1879     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1880     *      if the given array has zero length.
1881     *
1882     *  @since 0.0.5
1883     */
1884    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1885    public static final int maxContentLength( final CharSequence... a )
1886    {
1887        final var retValue = maxContentLength( Arrays.stream( requireNonNullArgument( a, "a" ) ) );
1888
1889        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1890        return retValue;
1891    }   //  maxContentLength()
1892
1893    /**
1894     *  <p>{@summary Normalizes the given String to a pure ASCII String.} This
1895     *  replaces 'Ã' by 'ss' and replaces all diacritical characters by their
1896     *  base form (that mean that 'Ã¼' gets 'u' and so on). For the normalizing
1897     *  of a search criteria, this should be sufficient, although it may cause
1898     *  issues for non-latin scripts, as for these the input can be mapped to
1899     *  the empty String.
1900     *
1901     *  @note   The scandinavian letters 'Ã¸' and 'Ã' are not diacritical
1902     *      letters, nevertheless they will be replaced.
1903     *
1904     *  @param  s   The input string.
1905     *  @return The normalised String, only containing ASCII characters; it
1906     *      could be empty.
1907     */
1908    public static final String normalizeToASCII( final CharSequence s )
1909    {
1910        final var input = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).toString()
1911            .replace( "Ã", "ss" )
1912            .replace( 'Ã¸', 'o' )
1913            .replace( 'Ã', 'O' );
1914        final var retValue = normalize( input, NFD )
1915            .replaceAll( "[^\\p{ASCII}]", EMPTY_STRING );
1916
1917        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1918        return retValue;
1919    }   //  normalizeToASCII()
1920
1921    /**
1922     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1923     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1924     *
1925     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1926     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1927     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1928     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1929     *  @param  mode    The
1930     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1931     *  @param  clip    {@code true} if the input string {@code s} should
1932     *      be cut in case it is longer than {@code length}, {@code false}
1933     *      if it has to be returned unchanged .
1934     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1935     *
1936     *  @since 0.0.5
1937     */
1938    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1939    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final boolean clip )
1940    {
1941        return pad( s, length, c, mode, clip ? CLIPPING_CUT : CLIPPING_NONE );
1942    }   //  pad()
1943
1944    /**
1945     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1946     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1947     *
1948     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1949     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1950     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1951     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1952     *  @param  mode    The
1953     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1954     *  @param  clip    The
1955     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Clipping clipping mode}.
1956     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1957     *
1958     *  @since 0.0.5
1959     */
1960    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1961    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final Clipping clip )
1962    {
1963        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1964        if( ((requireNonNullArgument( clip, "clip" ) == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE) && (length < 4)) || ((clip == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE) && (length < 5)) )
1965        {
1966            throw new ValidationException( format( "Length %d is too short for clipping mode %s", length, clip.toString() ) );
1967        }
1968        requireNonNullArgument( mode, "mode" );
1969
1970        final String retValue;
1971        final var currentLength = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
1972
1973        if( (length > 0) && (length != currentLength) )
1974        {
1975            if( currentLength > length )
1976            {
1977                retValue = clip.clip( s, length );
1978            }
1979            else
1980            {
1981                final var padSize = length - currentLength;
1982                retValue = mode.pad( s, padSize, c );
1983            }
1984        }
1985        else
1986        {
1987            retValue = s.toString();
1988        }
1989
1990        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1991        return retValue;
1992    }   //  pad()
1993
1994    /**
1995     *  Fills up the given string to the given length by adding blanks on both
1996     *  sides; will abbreviate the string if it is longer than the given
1997     *  length. The minimum length is 5.<br>
1998     *  <br>This is a shortcut to a call to
1999     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ) }.
2000     *
2001     *  @param  s   The string to format.
2002     *  @param  length  The desired length; minimum value is 5.
2003     *  @return The re-formatted string.
2004     *
2005     *  @see Padding#PADDING_CENTER
2006     *  @see Clipping#CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
2007     *
2008     *  @since 0.0.5
2009     */
2010    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2011    public static final String padCenter( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ); }
2012

2018     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_LEFT, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE ) }.

2021     *  @param  length  The desired length; the minimum value is 4.

2028     */
2029    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )

2051    /**
2052     *  <p>{@summary Surrounds the given String with double-quotes
2053     *  (&quot;, &amp;#34;).}</p>
2054     *  <p>When the double-quote is needed in a String constant, it has to be
2055     *  escaped with a backslash:</p>
2056     *  <pre><code>&quot;\&quot;â¦\&quot;&quot;</code></pre>
2057     *  <p>Sometimes, this is just ugly, and there this method comes into
2058     *  play.</p>
2059     *
2060     *  @param  s   The String to surround; can be {@code null}.
2061     *  @return The quoted String; will be {@code null} if the argument was
2062     *      {@code null} already.
2063     */
2064    public static final String quote( final CharSequence s )
2065    {
2066        final var retValue = isNull( s ) ? null : format( "\"%s\"u\"", s );
2067
2068        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2069        return retValue;
2070    }   //  quote()

2072    /**
2073     *  <p>{@summary This method replaces all diacritical characters in the
2074     *  input String by their base form.} That means that 'Ã¼' gets 'u', `Ã'
2075     *  gets 'E' and so on).</p>
2076     *  <p>This differs from
2077     *  {@link #normalizeToASCII(CharSequence)}
2078     *  as this method still allows non-ASCII characters in the output.</p>
2079     *
2080     *  @note   The scandinavian letters 'Ã¸' and 'Ã' are not diacritical
2081     *      letters, meaning they will not be replaced.
2082     *
2083     *  @param  s   The input string.
2084     *  @return The normalised String, not containing any diacritical
2085     *      characters.
2086     */
2087    public static final String removeDiacriticalMarks( final CharSequence s )
2088    {
2089        final var retValue = normalize( requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ), NFD )
2090            .replaceAll("\\p{InCombiningDiacriticalMarks}+", EMPTY_STRING );
2091
2092        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2093        return retValue;
2094    }   //  removeDiacriticalMarks()
